ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Implements fast, exact bootstrap Principal Component Analysis and Singular Value Decompositions for high dimensional data, as described in <doi:10.1080/01621459.2015.1062383> (see also <arXiv:1405.0922> ). For data matrices that are too large to operate on in memory, users can input objects with class 'ff' (see the 'ff' package), where the actual data is stored on disk. In response, this package will implement a block matrix algebra procedure for calculating the principal components (PCs) and bootstrap PCs. Depending on options set by the user, the 'parallel' package can be used to parallelize the calculation of the bootstrap PCs.

Implements fast, exact bootstrap Principal Component Analysis and Singular Value Decompositions for high dimensional data, as described in <doi:10.1080/01621459.2015.1062383> (see also <arXiv:1405.0922> ). For data matrices that are too large to operate on in memory, users can input objects with class 'ff' (see the 'ff' package), where the actual data is stored on disk. In response, this package will implement a block matrix algebra procedure for calculating the principal components (PCs) and bootstrap PCs. Depending on options set by the user, the 'parallel' package can be used to parallelize the calculation of the bootstrap PCs.

name: r-bootsvd
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.2" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-bootsvd
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/bootSVD_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/bootSVD/bootSVD_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 515a08a84073be8a5dcb69970e402d083ef1586a81de1440a3e8305e6542d830

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-ff
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ff

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('bootSVD')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('bootSVD')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://arxiv.org/abs/1405.0922
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: Implements fast, exact bootstrap Principal Component Analysis and Singular Value Decompositions for high dimensional data, as described in <doi:10.1080/01621459.2015.1062383> (see also <arXiv:1405.0922> ). For data matrices that are too large to operate on in memory, users can input objects with class 'ff' (see
    the 'ff' package), where the actual data is stored on disk. In response, this package will implement a block matrix algebra procedure for calculating the principal components (PCs) and bootstrap PCs. Depending on options set by the user, the 'parallel' package can be used to parallelize the calculation of the bootstrap
    PCs.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - TCLamnidis

# Package: bootSVD
# Title: Fast, Exact Bootstrap Principal Component Analysis for High Dimensional Data
# Description: Implements fast, exact bootstrap Principal Component Analysis and Singular Value Decompositions for high dimensional data, as described in <doi:10.1080/01621459.2015.1062383> (see also <arXiv:1405.0922> ). For data matrices that are too large to operate on in memory, users can input objects with class 'ff' (see the 'ff' package), where the actual data is stored on disk. In response, this package will implement a block matrix algebra procedure for calculating the principal components (PCs) and bootstrap PCs. Depending on options set by the user, the 'parallel' package can be used to parallelize the calculation of the bootstrap PCs.
# Version: 1.1
# Author: Aaron Fisher <afishe27@alumni.jh.edu>
# Maintainer: Aaron Fisher <afishe27@alumni.jh.edu>
# URL: http://arxiv.org/abs/1405.0922
# Depends: R (>= 3.0.2)
# Imports: ff, parallel
# License: GPL-2
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 6.0.1
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2021-02-01 22:28:49 UTC; aaronfisher
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2021-02-02 10:20:12 UTC
